sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"任命，委派"之意。
means: appoint ：通常指不经过选择的官方委任。
designate ：书面用语，侧重当权者或机构的选拔或任命，有时含强行指定的意味。
assign ：常指给一群人或个人分配、分派、指派或委派任务。
name ：普通用词，着重任命的结果，而不是过程。
nominate ：通常指为某一公职选择候选人，并将其提交给有决定权的人作最后决定。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"命名，称呼"之意。
means: name ： 含义最泛，指给人或物命名以示区别或便于记忆。
call ： 指给某人或某物取名字以某人或某物的特征称呼。
designate ： 指用特别的名字、符号或词句来称某人或某物。

sentence.Network_en: Japan'sPrime Minister-designate is completing his Cabinet today.
sentence.Network_cn: 日本的当选首相今日将完成组阁。

sentence.Network_en: Will you designate the flowers you wish?
sentence.Network_cn: 你能说出你想要的花 吗 ?

sentence.Network_en: There are efforts under way to designate the bridge a historic landmark.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们正在努力将这座桥定为历史遗迹。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (as an adjective): from Latin designatus 'designated', past participle of designare, based on signum 'a mark'. The verb dates from the late 18th cent

entry.def: When you designate someone or something as a particular thing, you formally give them that description or name.

example.ex: ...a man interviewed in one of our studies whom we shall designate as E...
example.tran: 在我们的一项研究中接受访谈的男子，我们称之为 E

example.ex: There are efforts under way to designate the bridge a historic landmark...
example.tran: 人们正在努力将这座桥定为历史遗迹。

entry.def: If something is designated for a particular purpose, it is set aside for that purpose.

example.ex: Some of the rooms were designated as offices.
example.tran: 其中一些房间被指定用作办公室。
专门给予少数族裔学生的奖学金

entry.def: When you designate someone as something, you formally choose them to do that particular job.

example.ex: The President's designated successor is his son.
example.tran: 总统的选定继承人是他的儿子。

entry.tran: （已受委派）尚未上任的;（已当选）尚未就职的
entry.def: Designate is used to describe someone who has been formally chosen to do a particular job, but has not yet started doing it.

example.ex: Japan's Prime Minister-designate is completing his Cabinet today.
example.tran: 日本的当选首相今日将完成组阁。

means.word_mean: 1. assign a name or title to
2. give an assignment to (a person) to a post, or assign a task to (a person)

sentences.sentence: "She was destined to become a great pianist"
"She was intended to become the director"

means.word_mean: 1. appointed but not yet installed in office

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =mark,表示"记号,信号,标志"; 2. 签署

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有意义的;重大的,重要的
stems_affixes.word_buile: significance[[n.意义,含义;重要性,重要的]]→adj.有意义的;重大的,重要的
in内部+sign记号,信号,标志+ia状态→内部标志

stems_affixes.value_cn: 分配,指派;[指定的]作业,[分派的]任务
stems_affixes.word_buile: assign派给,分配+ment表名词→n.分配,指派;[指定的]作业,[分派的]任务
consign[v.托运,托人看管]+ment表名词→n.托运,寄售
de加强+sign记号→做好记号→设计
designate[v.指明,指出;任命,指派]+ion表名词→designation指定

stems_affixes.value_cn: 旗, 军舰旗, 军旗, 徽章,舰旗[船上表示所属国家的旗帜]
stems_affixes.word_buile: en内部+sign记号,信号,标志→内部标志
resign[v.辞去,辞职,使听从[于],使顺从]+ation表名词→n.放弃,辞职,反抗
sign记号,信号,标志→n.符号；手势；征兆，迹象 v. 签名；作手势
sign记号,信号,标志+al→n.信号,暗号 v.发信号,用信号通知
sign记号,信号,标志+ature表名词→记号的东西→签名
sign记号,信号,标志+et做记号→图章

stems_affixes.value_cn: 意义,含义;重要性,重要的
stems_affixes.word_buile: signifi=signify[v.表示,意味;要紧,有重要性]+cance→n.意义,含义;重要性,重要的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 派给,分配;选定,指定[时间,地点等]
stems_affixes.word_buile: as加强+sign签署→指定
de加强+sign记号→做好记号→设计
de加强+sign记号+ate表动词→指定记号→指定,指明
con共同+sign记号,信号,标志→共同做记号→把……委托给别人

stems_affixes.value_cn: 辞去,辞职,使听从[于],使顺从
stems_affixes.word_buile: re回+sign签署→v.辞去,辞职,使听从[于],使顺从
sign记号,信号,标志→n.符号；手势；征兆，迹象 v. 签名；作手势
sign记号,信号,标志+al→n.信号,暗号 v.发信号,用信号通知

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使著名, 使显著, 使显眼, 向……发信号
stems_affixes.word_buile: signal信号+ize表动词→发信号
sign记号,信号,标志+et做记号→图章

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表示,意味;要紧,有重要性
stems_affixes.word_buile: sign记号,信号,标志+ify……化→用信号表示→象征

Sentence.sentence: If farmers like Bowman are able to use these seeds without paying the designated fee, it will remove the incentives for companies like Monsanto to innovate.

means.word_mean: 指派, 委任（某人任某职）

sentences.en: I'm designating you to act for me while I am away.
sentences.cn: 当我不在时, 我指派你来代替我。
